metadata.title: How to Get a YouTube Handle 2025: Setup Guide
metadata.description: Set up your YouTube handle (@username). Requirements, choosing your handle, and customization tips.

hero.headline: How to Get Your YouTube Handle
hero.subheadline: Claim your @username on YouTube. Your unique identifier across the platform.

sections.content: YouTube handles are unique @usernames that identify your channel. They appear in comments, Shorts, and your channel URL. Choose carefully—they're harder to change than display names. Here's how to claim and customize your handle.

content.title: Character Limits
content.description: 3-30 characters. Letters, numbers, underscores, periods only.

content.title: Uniqueness
content.description: Must be unique across all of YouTube. First come, first served.

content.title: Change Limits
content.description: Can change twice per 14 days. Choose wisely.

sections.title: Choosing Your Handle
content: Match your channel name if available
Avoid numbers unless part of brand

faq.question: What if my handle is taken?
faq.answer: Try variations: add underscores, abbreviate, use 'TV' or 'Official' suffix. Some handles are reserved—check different options.

faq.question: Can I change my handle later?
faq.answer: Yes, but limited to twice per 14 days. Your old handle becomes available immediately. Think carefully before changing.

faq.question: Is handle same as channel name?
faq.answer: No. Channel name is your display name (can include spaces, emoji). Handle is your @username (limited characters). They can differ.

faq.question: Do I need a handle?
faq.answer: YouTube assigns one if you don't choose. But claiming yours early ensures you get what you want before it's taken.
